name: Automata
slogan: The next industrial revolution should be for humans
description:
Automation isn’t solved. 

Even in factories, where automation is prolific, only one in ten automatable tasks is automated. The rest is done by people – sometimes in inhumane conditions, and often for minimum wage.

Our robot Eva and the revolutionary programming software, Choreograph, are going to redefine what it is to work, for everyone. The challenges awaiting us are unique. They loom large in difficulty and impact, and even big tech companies don’t dare to take them on.

For us to succeed, we need a team dedicated to solving these problems. We want radical people with wisdom from multifarious backgrounds.

Join us in building this future. We’ll have a lot of fun along the way.

jobs.title: Head of Sales & Partnerships
jobs.description:
The Head of Sales and Partnerships at Automata will be instrumental in leading the transition away from ‘founder-led’ sales to one led by an experienced sales leader.

You will be accountable for building and leading the sales team in achieving x3 revenue growth in 2020 and scoping out 2021 targets. Using your experience as a winning sales leader in a high growth startup environment you’ll guide Automata through commercial maturity and multiple successful funding rounds. 

In more specific terms, here’s what we’d like to see in you:

You have significant experience in the robotics & automation industries 
You’re an excellent sales person who has built a sales team before
You’ve seen a company through £1-10m growth
You have the strategic and technical bandwidth to build our sales operation into a substantially sized team in just a few years
You’re well versed with market research, go-to-market strategies, working with Product Managers, and then eventually team building and delegation
You can make the strategic calls to identify not just which customers to go after, but also which markets and sectors, and are capable of devising and executing go-to-market plans
A coaching mindset - ability to turn mid-level performers into high-performers or manage underperformance out
Experience setting truly attainable sales targets whilst focusing on high growth
If you haven’t run any sales operation or built a team before, this is probably not for you - unless you’re a prodigy

jobs.title: Commercial Intern
jobs.description:
We are looking for an intern to join our commercial team to help our research into Product Market Fit, execute on the findings to help our growth, and support our sales team with all our customer enquiries 🚀 

Join us in building this future. We’ll have a lot of fun along the way. 

What will you be doing?

Identifying new and interesting markets, getting in contact with research prospects and conducting interviews (over the phone or on-site) 
Synthesising interview insights and second market research to inform sales and marketing strategy
Leveraging our current customers use case data, developing an outbound strategy to find high quality leads that best suit our robot
Helping our sales team with screening and qualifying new prospects (we’re getting lots of interest!) 
Ongoing market research around the robotics industry
Assisting our support and success teams with getting our customers up to speed and loving our robots
Getting the most out of CRM system, Hubspot
Setting up demos of Eva for customers and events

What you will bring to the role? 

Proven analytical skills
Ability to understand a new industry quickly 
Interested in or experience working within a technology focused business, if its robotics even better
Ability to A/B test hypotheses, gain insights quickly - action, evaluate and reiterate on the learnings 
Confidence in communicating and building relationships with prospects, potential customers and current customers
Fast paced environments bring out your calm and unflappable nature 
You don’t wait around to be told what to do, you’re chomping at the bit to get stuff done
Excellent communication skills, flawless written English
Willing to learn how to program our robot (you don’t need to be a technical whiz but willingness to learn and get your hands dirty is critical)
Open to working across the commercial “stack”: sales, marketing, support, success, and product

jobs.title: Head of Finance
jobs.description:
Automata is a fast growing robotics startup and we are looking for a full-time Head of Finance to own the company's Financial strategy, and contribute to our ambitious growth plans. 

You will lead us through strategic financial planning and risk assessment including periodic forecasts, reviews and annual budgeting. As our Head of Finance you will collaborate with our leadership team to advise on all financial matters from optimal stock levels to pricing strategy, to helping scale Automata effectively and responsibly.

Your key responsibilities:

Ensure Automata's vision and strategy are achieved by setting financial KPIs; ensure the business is managed against those KPIs
Produce comprehensive financial models to identify risks & opportunities and track growth plans
Forward budgets and re-forecasting activities throughout the year to support the business as it continues to scale
Produce monthly management accounts to assist in management decision making
Develop cash flow management solutions, such as volume purchase discounts or extended payment terms
Help the company to get the capital needed to operate and optimize the mix of capital between equity and debt
Drive business expansion in new markets and advice on ad hoc tax requirements and potential risks

What we're looking for in you:

Qualified accountant with significant post qualification experience in a strategically driven finance lead role
Good listener with strong communication and presentation skills
Strong commercial awareness and ability to understand how the business works and where the levers are
Strong analytical skills and ability to clearly formulate and implement business strategies
Gross margin expertise and stock experience. It would also be great if you had previous experience in a manufacturing company and exposure to business expansion in new markets

jobs.title: Front-End Developer
jobs.description:
We are looking for a Front-End Developer who will focus on delivering value to our customers by maintaining and improving ‘Choreograph’ - the software behind our robotic arm, Eva. 

You will be an integral part of the Software Development Team, transforming user feedback into developments, improving User Experience and adding new features.

What will you be doing?

Owning responsibility for new features and fixing issues based on customer feedback - helping the support team to gather information with your technical knowledge
Working on exciting new features in the Software Development Team roadmap 
Handling support requests from customers (as part of a rotation), helping them to develop their robotic use cases to great success
Helping in the release of Choreograph updates from the beginning (conception) to the end (implementation and testing)
You will also have the opportunity to learn about other technical areas such as Back-End, DevOps, System Development, Firmware and Manufacturing, depending on your interests and strengths

What will you bring to the role? 

Good experience (3-4+ years) with Front-End development, especially React (bonus: Three.js, 3D rendering and SVG)
Good communication and organizational skills, comfortable interacting with customers and working with our sales and support team
Knowledge of the basic concepts of User Experience
Some experience with Back-End development, understanding of API usage and design (bonus: Go, SQL)
Bonus: Linux and C++ development to be able to dive deeper into our stack
